alert.note: Alert for Carson; Gray; Hansford; Hutchinson; Moore; Ochiltree; Potter; Roberts; Sherman (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 07 at 5:49PM CDT until July 07 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Carson County in the Panhandle of Texas... Hutchinson County in the Panhandle of Texas... Northwestern Gray County in the Panhandle of Texas... Hansford County in the Panhandle of Texas... Northeastern Potter County in the Panhandle of Texas... Southeastern Sherman County in the Panhandle of Texas... Western Roberts County in the Panhandle of Texas... Southwestern Ochiltree County in the Panhandle of Texas... Eastern Moore County in the Panhandle of Texas... * Until 645 PM CDT. * At 548 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 14 miles west of Gruver to 6 miles southeast of Sunray to 8 miles northwest of Lake Meredith to 5 miles east of Four Way, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect some tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Hail damage to vehicles is expected. * Locations impacted include... Borger, Spearman, Fritch, Sunray, Stinnett, Gruver, Skellytown, Sanford, Farnsworth, Waka, Pringle, Morse, Four Way, Lake Meredith and Masterson. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Carson; Gray; Hansford; Hutchinson; Moore; Ochiltree; Potter; Roberts; Sherman
